title: Board independence and ESG disclosure quality: Evidence from the S&P 500
abstract: Using panel data from S&P 500 firms (2010-2019), we examine how the proportion of independent directors affects the quality of ESG disclosure measured by Bloomberg ESG scores. Fixed effects regression with robust standard errors reveals a positive and significant relationship.
keywords: board independence, ESG disclosure, corporate governance

title: Ownership structure and dividend policy in emerging markets
abstract: This study examines the impact of institutional ownership, family ownership, and ownership concentration on dividend payout decisions of listed firms in five ASEAN countries using GMM estimation.
keywords: ownership structure, dividend policy, emerging markets

title: The impact of CSR on consumer purchasing behavior: A survey analysis
abstract: Using a survey of 300 consumers in the US, we examine how perceived corporate social responsibility affects consumer willingness to pay premium prices for products.
keywords: CSR, consumer behavior, willingness to pay

title: ESG scores and stock market returns: International evidence
abstract: We investigate whether firms with higher ESG scores earn higher risk-adjusted stock returns using a panel of 8,000 firms from 40 countries. We control for firm size, leverage, and various governance characteristics.

title: Corporate governance and sustainability: A systematic literature review
abstract: This paper systematically reviews 200 empirical studies on the relationship between corporate governance mechanisms and sustainability/ESG outcomes, published between 2000 and 2023.

title: Board gender diversity, CEO duality, and sustainability reporting quality in European firms
abstract: Drawing on agency and stakeholder theories, we examine the individual and joint effects of board gender diversity and CEO duality on the quality of sustainability reporting across 600 European listed firms from 2012-2020 using fixed effects regression.
keywords: board diversity, CEO duality, sustainability reporting

title: Institutional ownership, ESG performance, and firm value: A mediation analysis
abstract: We investigate whether ESG performance mediates the relationship between institutional ownership and firm value. Using structural equation modeling on 1,200 US firms, we find that institutional owners drive ESG improvements, which subsequently enhance Tobin's Q.
keywords: institutional ownership, ESG, firm value, mediation

title: Capital structure decisions and board characteristics: Evidence from Pakistan
abstract: This study examines the impact of capital structure on firm performance using 200 listed Pakistani firms. Board size, board independence, and CEO duality are used as control variables.

title: Audit committee effectiveness and environmental disclosure in mining firms
abstract: This paper investigates whether audit committee size, independence, and financial expertise drive the quality of environmental disclosures in 100 mining firms listed on the LSE and ASX using content analysis of sustainability reports.

title: ESG performance and credit risk: The moderating role of board independence
abstract: We examine whether ESG performance ratings reduce credit default risk for European banks, and whether the positive effect is stronger when boards have a higher proportion of independent directors.
keywords: ESG, credit risk, board independence, banking

title: Corporate governance quality index and CSR practices in Asia-Pacific
abstract: We construct a composite corporate governance quality index combining board structure, ownership, and transparency indicators, and test its association with CSR reporting quality across 800 Asia-Pacific firms using panel regression.

title: Green innovation and board diversity: A case study of three Nordic companies
abstract: Through semi-structured interviews with 15 board members and executives, and analysis of internal documents, we explore how board gender and nationality diversity influences green innovation strategies in three large Nordic companies.
keywords: green innovation, board diversity, case study

title: Family ownership and integrated reporting adoption in South Africa
abstract: We investigate whether family-controlled firms are more or less likely to adopt integrated reporting under the IIRC framework, using logistic regression on 150 JSE-listed firms from 2013-2019.
keywords: family ownership, integrated reporting, South Africa

title: Board structure, ESG scores, and financial performance: A three-stage analysis
abstract: We analyze 2,000 firms globally using three-stage least squares: first, how board size and independence affect Refinitiv ESG scores; second, how ESG scores affect ROA; and third, the direct effect of board structure on ROA.

title: Sustainability assurance and audit committee characteristics: Who demands verification?
abstract: We examine whether audit committee independence, financial expertise, and meeting frequency predict whether firms voluntarily seek external assurance of their sustainability reports, using probit models on 500 EU firms.
keywords: sustainability assurance, audit committee, external verification
